humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.7 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The histological type is highly differentiated invasive ductal carcinoma, which follows the same rules as NOS for staging based on the largest tumor size. The presence of focal intraductal components and the tumor classification NOS, GI, pT2NOLOVORX do not affect the T stage. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor diameter is specified as 2.7 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 designation is given when the tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
